main event: On July 25, 1957, a civilian reported seeing a round bright silver object the size of a dime at arm's length moving from east to north for four minutes, following a zigzag path.
interesting points: The object was described as bright silver and about the size of a dime at arm's length.
It moved in a zigzag pattern and was visible for four minutes.
The conclusion of the sighting was that it was probably caused by an aircraft.
The report indicates that there was insufficient data for evaluation regarding the possible cause of the sighting.
The observation was made in North Havre, Montana, under clear sky conditions with no wind and hot, dry weather.
